intro: Halimolobos lasiolobus, commonly known as the rough-lobed halimolobos, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively uncommon in horticulture.
